ingredients: 500g mutton or beef (with bones), 1 large onion (sliced), 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp fennel seeds, 2-3 green cardamoms, 2 bay leaves, 1-inch cinnamon stick, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1 tsp garam masala, ½ tsp turmeric powder, 1 tbsp wheat flour (for thickening), 4 tbsp ghee or oil, Salt to taste.
instructions: Heat ghee in a large pot and add cumin seeds, cardamoms, bay leaves, and cinnamon stick. Sauté for a minute.
Add onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a couple of minutes.
Add mutton or beef pieces, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until the meat is browned.
Add enough water to cover the meat, cover the pot, and simmer on low heat for 2-3 hours until the meat is tender.
In a small bowl, mix wheat flour with water to make a slurry. Add this to the stew to thicken it.
Sprinkle garam masala, cook for another 10 minutes, and adjust the consistency by adding water if needed. Garnish with fresh cilantro and lemon slices. Serve with naan or rice.
